question: Match the following:
column_I: Hydrocolloids from brown and red algae
column_II: At least a half carried out by algae
Increase the level of dissolved oxygen in their immediate environment
Form the basis of the food cycles of all aquatic animals
Used as food
Algin and carrageen
matches: Carbon dioxide fixation on earth–At least a half carried out by algae
Photosynthetic algae–Increase the level of dissolved oxygen in their immediate environment
Primary producers of energy-rich compounds–Form the basis of the food cycles of all aquatic animals
Porphyra, Laminaria and Sargassum–Used as food
Hydrocolloids from brown and red algae–Algin and carrageen
answer: Carbon dioxide fixation on earth–At least a half carried out by algae, Photosynthetic algae–Increase the level of dissolved oxygen in their immediate environment, Primary producers of energy-rich compounds–Form the basis of the food cycles of all aquatic animals, Porphyra, Laminaria and Sargassum–Used as food, Hydrocolloids from brown and red algae–Algin and carrageen

question: Match the following:
column_I: Used to grow microbes and in preparations of ice-creams and jellies
column_II: Commercial product obtained from Gelidium and Gracilaria
A unicellular alga rich in proteins
Chlorophyceae, Phaeophyceae and Rhodophyceae
Agar
Used as food supplement even by space travellers
matches: Agar–Commercial product obtained from Gelidium and Gracilaria
Chlorella–A unicellular alga rich in proteins
Classes of algae–Chlorophyceae, Phaeophyceae and Rhodophyceae
Gelidium and Gracilaria–Agar
Used to grow microbes and in preparations of ice-creams and jellies–Used as food supplement even by space travellers
answer: Agar–Commercial product obtained from Gelidium and Gracilaria, Chlorella–A unicellular alga rich in proteins, Classes of algae–Chlorophyceae, Phaeophyceae and Rhodophyceae, Gelidium and Gracilaria–Agar, Used to grow microbes and in preparations of ice-creams and jellies–Used as food supplement even by space travellers

question: Match the following:
column_II: Unicellular, colonial or filamentous
Chlorophyll a and b
Contain protein besides starch
Oil droplets
An inner layer of cellulose and an outer layer of pectose
matches: Chlorophyceae members–Unicellular, colonial or filamentous
Green colour in algae–Chlorophyll a and b
Pyrenoids–Contain protein besides starch
Food stored in some algae–Oil droplets
Green algae cell wall–An inner layer of cellulose and an outer layer of pectose
answer: Chlorophyceae members–Unicellular, colonial or filamentous, Green colour in algae–Chlorophyll a and b, Pyrenoids–Contain protein besides starch, Food stored in some algae–Oil droplets, Green algae cell wall–An inner layer of cellulose and an outer layer of pectose

question: Match the following:
column_II: Discoid, plate-like, reticulate, cup-shaped, spiral or ribbon-shaped
By fragmentation
By flagellated zoospores produced in zoosporangia
Considerable variation in the type and formation of sex cells
Chlamydomonas, Volvox, Ulothrix, Spirogyra and Chara
matches: Chloroplast shapes in green algae–Discoid, plate-like, reticulate, cup-shaped, spiral or ribbon-shaped
Vegetative reproduction in green algae–By fragmentation
Asexual reproduction in green algae–By flagellated zoospores produced in zoosporangia
Sexual reproduction in green algae–Considerable variation in the type and formation of sex cells
Common green algae–Chlamydomonas, Volvox, Ulothrix, Spirogyra and Chara
answer: Chloroplast shapes in green algae–Discoid, plate-like, reticulate, cup-shaped, spiral or ribbon-shaped, Vegetative reproduction in green algae–By fragmentation, Asexual reproduction in green algae–By flagellated zoospores produced in zoosporangia, Sexual reproduction in green algae–Considerable variation in the type and formation of sex cells, Common green algae–Chlamydomonas, Volvox, Ulothrix, Spirogyra and Chara

question: Match the following:
column_II: Primarily in marine habitats
Show great variation
Simple branched, filamentous forms
Profusely branched forms which may reach a height of 100 metres
Chlorophyll a, c, carotenoids and xanthophylls
matches: Phaeophyceae habitat–Primarily in marine habitats
Variation in size and form–Show great variation
Ectocarpus–Simple branched, filamentous forms
Kelps–Profusely branched forms which may reach a height of 100 metres
Pigments in brown algae–Chlorophyll a, c, carotenoids and xanthophylls
answer: Phaeophyceae habitat–Primarily in marine habitats, Variation in size and form–Show great variation, Ectocarpus–Simple branched, filamentous forms, Kelps–Profusely branched forms which may reach a height of 100 metres, Pigments in brown algae–Chlorophyll a, c, carotenoids and xanthophylls
